description: The round payoff this round was 3. You, Kate chose to play option 2.John chose to play option 2. You received a payoff of -3000.
Mutual defection (both choosing option 2) leads to catastrophic losses due to the 1000x multiplier, making coordination on option 1 critical
John’s model (o3-mini) adapts unpredictably despite its default being option 1, risking mutual defection if Kate deviates
Exploiting John’s default action (option 1) by choosing option 2 risks retaliation, as seen in the -3000 payoff
Repeated rounds incentivize avoiding greed (choosing option 2) to prevent irreversible losses, favoring mutual cooperation (option 1)
The round input’s magnitude amplifies risk, requiring cautious play to avoid scaled penalties
